name: Headerbar Style for Gnome 3.16+ Dark Theme
description:
This style is broken and no longer maintained. See below...

This is a fork of this style, which does not work with the global dark theme because it relies on a broken add-on to automatically select the correct theme. I've made these changes:
  • Works with dark theme (and dark theme only)
  • Blue highlight for the URL bar when you're typing in it!
  • Tab height increased to fit in with other gnome apps
  • No rounded corners at all (though there's code you can uncomment if you want rounded corners). They create ragged edges and split-screen windows aren't supposed to have rounded corners anyway.
Feedback and Merge Requests are welcome on Github.
additional_info: Update 2017.07.27: I decided that the compact theme (or its dark variant) is good enough for me. With that, and this theme will stop working permanently with Firefox 57, so I have decided not to do any more work on this style. The compact theme ships with FF53+ by default, and can be enabled in older versions with this extension. Then, you can fix the minimize/maximize/close buttons with the userChrome.css given here, which will continue to work past FF57. And, though it will also break with FF57, for the moment you can use a separate extension like this to move your tabs below the address bar. Update 2017.02.25: There is a working version of the gnome theme again, so I intend to continue maintaining this style. However, I'm rather short on time at the moment so that likely won't be until May. Update 2016.10.16: The firefox gnome theme does not work on the current release of Firefox. That makes this style somewhat pointless, so I will not be maintaining it until further notice. See here for more details. I have been using the firefox developer theme in the meantime.
